Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 325998: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Elf Atochem S.A., an international French-based chemical conglomerate, agreed to plead guilty and pay fines totaling $8.5 million for participating in two international conspiracies that suppressed competition in the industrial chemical markets for monochloroacetic acid  and organic peroxides.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/atr/public/press_releases/2002/10835.htm

Description: To resolve allegations that they contaminated groundwater at the Ivy Industrial Park, Bostik Inc. and Sandvik Inc. agreed to pay civil penalties of $2.5 million and $21.7 million for infrastructure improvements and DEP investigatory costs. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided evenly between them.

Description: Solvay Specialty Polymers and Arkema Inc. agreed to pay a toal of $1.84 million to resolve a class action alleging that a plant in Gloucester County, New Jersey caused perfluorinated compounds (PFCs) to enter into the Paulsboro municipal water supply system. The settlement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally between them.
Private Litigation Case Title: Thomas et al v. Solvay Specialty Polymers USA, LLC et al
Info Source: https://www.nj.com/gloucester-county/2016/04/nj_plastics_company_settles_contaminated_water_law.html
